project.name: Repose Components - Datastores POM
project.description:
Repose uses "datastores" to store various data.
By default, the local datastore is used, implemented as an in memory EH Cache. A distributed datastore can be configured, which allows "striped" data storage across all the nodes in a cluster.
Datastores implement a specific API which is outlined below:
get(key) - access data associated with a specific key value
put(key, value) - stores a piece of data and associates it with a key value put(key, value, time, unit) can be used to specify a duration of the data's time to live in specific units.
patch(key, value) - used to update a specific value in the datastore patch(key, value, time, unit) can be used to update a specific value in the datastore as well as the time values associated with it
remove(key) - removes the key value pair associated with the provided key
removeAll() - removes all elements in the datastore
getName() - gets the name of the datastore
